intro: Cryptophoranthus atropurpureus, commonly known as the purple-flowered cryptophoranthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
